intro: Minuria gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's minuria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
